title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5005.5 - Early service retirement reductions in the case of members with a date of membership on or after January 1, 2010
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5005.5 - Early service retirement reductions in the case of members with a date of membership on or after January 1, 2010

State Regulations

In the case of any member with a date of membership on or
after January 1, 2010 (Tier 5) retiring for service prior to age 62 but no
earlier than age 55, other than any such member who has attained age 57 and
accrued at least 30 years of service, the reductions in such member's service
retirement benefit otherwise computed without optional modification shall be
administered as follows: (a) for each
full month of the first 24 full months by which retirement predates age 62, such benefit shall be reduced by 1/180 per month; and, in addition, if
applicable; (b) for each full month
of the first 60 full months by which retirement predates age 60, such benefit
shall be reduced by a further 1/240 per month. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21

5005.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
